audioJson.name: Phonographic cylinder
audioJson.fact1: This format had several different material compositions: brown wax (metal soap), molded wax (metal soap), and Blue Amberol (celluloid)
audioJson.fact2: Early brown wax cylinders would commonly wear out after they were played only a few dozen times
audioJson.fact3: While this format was typically 2.25” in diameter and around 4.25” long, they could be smaller (1.33" in diameter) or larger (5" in diameter)
